title: Domain 1.2: Compare and contrast networking appliances, applications, and functions.
content:
🖥️ Router

A device that forwards data packets between networks, using IP addresses to determine the best route.

🔄 Switch

Operates at Layer 2 (Data Link) and forwards data between devices on the same network using MAC addresses.

🛡️ Firewall

A security appliance that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on security rules.

🕵️‍♂️ IDS/IPS (Intrusion Detection/Prevention System)

IDS

Monitors network traffic for suspicious activity and alerts on possible attacks.

IPS

Actively blocks or prevents detected threats.

🔄 Load Balancer

Distributes incoming network traffic across multiple servers to ensure no single server is overwhelmed.

🌐 Proxy

Acts as an intermediary between users and the internet to filter traffic, improve security, and cache data.

💾 Network-Attached Storage (NAS)

A dedicated file storage system that provides shared data access over a network.

🏙️ Storage Area Network (SAN)

A high-performance network that provides block-level storage, typically for enterprise use.

📶 Wireless

Access Point (AP)

A device that allows wireless devices to connect to a wired network.

Controller

Manages multiple wireless access points within a network to optimize coverage and performance.

🌐 Applications

🌍 Content Delivery Network (CDN)

A distributed network of servers that deliver web content (images, videos, HTML, etc.) to users based on their geographic location, improving load times and redundancy.

🔑 Functions

🌐 Virtual Private Network (VPN)

Provides a secure, encrypted tunnel for remote users to access a network, ensuring privacy and data security over public networks.

📊 Quality of Service (QoS)

A set of technologies that prioritize network traffic based on importance—ensuring critical applications (e.g., voice, video) have sufficient bandwidth.

⏳ Time to Live (TTL)

A value in an IP packet that specifies the maximum number of hops (routers) the packet can pass through before being discarded, preventing infinite loops.
